channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two examples of selfish lime users Vicarage Grove, 22nd November
item.description:
This is frequent it is selfish and shows up Lime as being indulgent toward their customers and ultimately as anti community

item.title: Abandoned Lime Datchelor Place ramp to D’eynesford Estate moved to top of Datchelor Place and Church Street, 22nd November
item.description:
This damaged bike was blocking the disabled ramp onto the D’eynesford Estate. It has been moved to the top of the road. Datchelor Place is a pedestrian only street. All limes will be removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Datchelor Place, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Large amount of food waste, 22nd November

item.title: Not cleaned ., 22nd November
item.description:
This is a post I made in late September, these water gullies( at the front of properties on the pavements) still have not been touched, these were put in by Bromley council and should be cleaned regularly, the rubbish is still building up in them, and now they also have leaves in. Last report was marked as fixed , but nothing has been done . These are not the road gutters , they are on the pavement, I suggest if the current contractor does not know where they are , they come and walk Crown Lane , residents in Crown Lane are fed up with not having the street cleaned properly . These gullies were installed to take excess water off the pavement when it rains heavily, so the fore they are Bromleys responsibility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree in Kelly Street, 22nd November
item.description:
There is sign to pollard the trees. We strongly as residents believe this is not needed. Over pruning risk damaging the tree. We have actual issues with trees on our street (already reported) One is dead. On is at risk. Please use the limited Camden resource addressing this more immediate issue Please don’t pollard our trees based on a schedule. If inspected, it will be clear no immediate need for pollarding Thank you M
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Kelly Street, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
